home.name: Aleksi Pynnönen
home.para1: I am eager to learn new skills, use new and existing skills for work tasks. I like being able to advance work tasks and solve problems regarding work tasks. As an employee I adapt to working independently and in a group. I am interested in utilizing and using AI.
home.para2: My more familiar programming languages are JavaScript and its library React that I have used for a couple of years in different Software projects like Thesis, practical trainings and personal projects. Practical trainings have given me the opportunity to get familiar with and use Git and TypeScript programming.
home.para3: I have a basic understanding of responsive design and REST API. I have also advanced my skills after studies with FullstackOpen exercises bringing together React front-end, NodeJS backend and REST API into one fullstack entity. Also Microsoft Career Bootcamp in where I got familiar with Azure and AI in which I am interested in learning more and using more. I have used Github Copilot in my free time projects to experiment and get used to using AI coding tools in coding projects.

about.title: My hobbies
about.drawingpara: I have attended the City of Jyväskylä School of Fine Arts for a total of 4 years doing basic studies in fine arts an part of advanced studies. I have studied art as optional study in primary school and 4 courses in upper secondary school. Pictures below are a part of my free time art collection made using pencil, marker pen and photoshop.
about.cyclingpara: Cycling is my favorite form of excercise. I cycle through all seasons.
about.gamingpara: Gaming is my favorite way to spend free time. Gaming lets you experience many stories, explore different worlds, enjoy music and coperate with other players.
about.3dmodelingpara: Game level 3D modeling and Blender 3D modeling. I have developed game levels with Valves Source game engines Hammer level editor to make game level for Counter strike global offensive (CSGO) and Garry's mod. With Blender I have made 3D models for a DayZ mod for buildings.
about.summerhobbiespara: Summer hobbies disc golf and archery.

skills.allfrontend: HTML, CSS, Bootstrap, JavaScript, React, TypeScript
skills.allother: Python, Git, Docker, SQL, Azure, AI Basics, Github Copilot
skills.allvisual: Blender, Figma, Responsive design, Photoshop, Game level design

portfolio.title: Portfolio
portfolio.thesispara1: Bachelor’s Thesis. Bachelor’s Degree Programme in Information and Communication Technology.
portfolio.thesispara2: The purpose of the Thesis was to visualize road traffic data collected by Fintraffic’s LAM-datapoints. The target was to visualize the traffic volumes and speeds of road traffic and develop an application to visualize the LAM station road traffic data. The client of the Thesis was JAMK University of Applied Sciences and Tieto tuottamaan project.
portfolio.thesispara3: Visualization application was developed with JavaScript’s React framework. Finland’s map was added to the applications main view with react-simple-maps components and LAM-datapoint markers were added to the map. Visualization view needed to be opened and closed so that function was added to map markers. A column chart was added to visualization view with React Google charts to visualize LAM-datapoint data. LAM-datapoint selection was added to map markers along with automatic Digitraffic API call for data. Column chart speed column selection was added to visualize selected speed with that driven speeds time of day.
portfolio.thesispara4: The targets of the Thesis were fulfilled. Compliant with requirements the application was created to functionally visualize LAM stations road traffic data. The application enables observing driven speeds and speeding of the LAM stations. It is also possible to check when the speeds were driven.
portfolio.practical2para1: The main task for practical training at Neuwo was to edit Neuwo's UI. Neuwo wanted their UI to be made more practical and better looking. The task consisted of editing the UI for multilayered (probably N-ary Tree) Tree data structure to show the three layers side by side. The data shown should be changed depending on which of the layers data was selected.
portfolio.practical2para2: Practical training included the use of technologies such as React, TypeScript, CSS and Github.
portfolio.practical1para1: The first task at practical training was to deploy Lam visualization prototype to a web server. Lam visualization was made during my thesis and needed to be deployd to a web server.
portfolio.practical1para2: The second task was to study and put existing applications from older web server to docker containers.
portfolio.practical1para3: The third task was to add the missing, new and improved functions to Lam visualization protoype.
portfolio.practical1para4: The fourth task was to study and analyze Lam data with python.
portfolio.practical1para5: The fifth task was to study and test AI models on a computer. The tested AI models were Meta's Code Llama, FinGPT3 and Stable Diffusion.
portfolio.practical1para6: The final task was to find, clean and edit datasets with python code for learning material.
portfolio.bonsky: Bonky Digital Oy student customer project
portfolio.bonskypara1: Student customer project for Bonsky Digital OY was done as project course. Students would make 4-5 people student groups and select topics that companies had given to University of Applied Sciences. The companies had a contact person working with the student group with the given topic.
portfolio.bonskypara2: My student group selected Bonsky Digital OY's topic of creating web application to fetch JSON files, file data display, search through data, data editing and data deletion.
portfolio.bonskypara3: The technologies I ended up using in the project were Figma for the prototypes, CSS and SASS for visual, React and Javascript for frontend coding. My main contributions to project were Accordion component, Breadcrumbs component, Info text component, data deletion option, connecting Routes and testing application and checking if there were any areas to improve.
portfolio.gameprojectpara1: Game project course was for students to make a game using modern game engines like Unity or Unreal engine. My group of 4 students chose Unity for game development. Our group decided on a 3D rogue like game with procedurally generated castle dungeon as the setting.
portfolio.gameprojectpara2: My role on our group was to make most of 3D models and some animations for them and the game trailer. Some 3D models like the player, normal skeleton enemies were free basic weapons were free to download and use from Unity store. The games final boss was custom made and animated by me. I also contributed by making furniture for the game and finding textures for walls and floors.
portfolio.gameprojectpara3: Blender was used for all the 3D models I made. Most models I worked on were basic furniture like chairs, tables, barrels, doors and pillars. More complicated models I worked on were torch, scythe and final boss grim reaper. Grim reapers animations were made using Blender.
portfolio.gameprojectpara4: The game trailer was made using ingame gameplay footage and edited using DaVinci Resolve video editing software.
portfolio.algroithmspara1: Algorithms and data structures course final excercise was to choose from different Algorithms to code and test the chosen one.
portfolio.algroithmspara2: We made a web page that allowed testing of different Javascript loops, varying data sizes and loop counts. I mostly focused on coding Javascript loop tests, data sizes and loop counts.
portfolio.3dmodelingpara1: 3D model of forest landscape was made during 3D modeling basics course.
portfolio.3dmodelingpara2: The 3D model of forest landscape was made using Blender. The overall land area was made using a tool for landscape. Trees were made by first modeling the trunk, then adding branches and finally using branch with leaves image to complete the tree.
portfolio.animationpara1: Fireball 2d short animation for interface and usability course final exercise.
portfolio.animationpara2: The animation was made with Photoshop and Premiere video editing software.
portfolio.webproject1para1: Web project 1 group project. Group project to make a couple prototype web of based games to be accessible from a website.
portfolio.webproject1para2: My role was to make the websites intro page with transition animation to the main page. Main page had the icon buttons with links to the prototype web games.
portfolio.webproject2para1: Web project 2 group project. Group project to make a prototype Car rental website with PHP to search and rent cars.
portfolio.gamelevel: Operation metro Garry's mod game level
portfolio.gamelevelpara1: Free time project Garry's mod game level Operation metro inspired by Battlefield 3 and Battlefield 4 game level Operation metro.
portfolio.gamelevelpara2: The game level has been in development since 2019 and is still a prototype. The game level is made with Source game engines Hammer level editor.
